content: the wiki is down and the moment, but should be back online later this weekend.

Hi everyone! I'm Samriddhi , a student interested in contributing to BRL-CAD for GSoC 2026. I've been looking at Issue #102 regarding the LS-DYNA k-file converter. I’m currently setting up my local build environment to explore the code. I'm excited to learn more about BRL-CAD’s geometry conversion logic.

Hii everyone!
Myself Deep Raj, a final year student at MNIT Jaipur with expertise in Javascript, python.
looking forward to contribure in GSOC'26 with your guidance.
will truly appreciate your efforts.

Hey @Deep Raj welcome to the community
You may want to take a look at the projects in the brl cad repository and also checkout previous years issue list, pick a project that fits your goals of learning and exploring

Hi everyone,
I’ve cloned the BRL-CAD repo and attempted a native Windows build using CMake + Visual Studio 2022.

Configuration succeeds, but the bext dependency build fails mid-way (MSB8066), which I understand is a known Windows limitation.

I’m primarily interested in JS/web-based contributions, so I’m planning to focus on areas like the Online Geometry Viewer and related tooling that don’t require a full native build.

Could you point me to JS-friendly components or small starter issues where I can begin contributing?

The build with Visual Studio 2022 doesn't work, unfortunately. See #brlcad > general chat

However, for developing Java Script ad-ons on Windows you can start with the binary installation file provided with the release.

Hii everyone!
I am Nakul Grover, a third year student at IIIT Delhi with expertise in Java, python, ML.
looking forward to contribure in GSOC'26 with your guidance.
will truly appreciate your efforts.

Hello Friends,
My name is Abhishek , looking forward to connect with everyone,
I have previous experience of Qt/Qml :slight_smile:

Hi ,
Myself Vraj Mevada ,currently 2nd year CSE student at VIT Chennai,
I am currently interested in this issue https://github.com/opencax/GSoC/issues/110
But before that , I’d like to get more familiar with the contribution workflow. Are there any current issues or beginner-friendly tasks you would recommend investigating as a starting point?
I have experience with C++ ,Qt.
Hi @Vraj Mevada, this is an OpenSCAD project idea. They have their own chat: https://web.libera.chat/?channel=#openscad You should post your question there.
